column1:
kaptainkool,"2011-12-20T17:34:38.993Z","I be the flyin' dutchman!!","

Well, I got this set yesterday not sure of how good this set was going to be, but surprisingly it wasn't that bad. This set wasn't my aim though
column2: when I was hunting for some well deserved lego. Best of all, no stickers!&nbsp

column1: The flying dutchman is mostly green, with
column3: dark green head, because his head is mostly hairy, so his&nbsp
column5: face is printed on unlike other minifig heads. the hat is the same as Davy Jones's hat from the Black Pearl POTC set, except green and a printed rip on the front along&nbsp
column7: line. He does look weird when you look at him from the left,&nbsp
column8: because his printed nose is pointing to the right. The same dumb old&nbsp
column9: cutlass is in his hand, and Indy's satchel is slapped on him&nbsp
column10: with a pale light green hue. His hands are new neon light green and his ghosty tail is the same as the genie's in CM series 6. Spongebob and Patrick are in their piratey attire, and spongebob's hat has a printed square skull and bones which I didn't realize from the pic. Patrick has a cool new map which you could reuse along with his torso for a custom pirate.

column1: The ship is ghosty green, of course you get alot of green pieces for that creepy look. The sail is hard plastic and the emblem is printed on, not a sticker, though it is only held up with one clip brick on the back, so it is not that sturdy.
column3: flag on the crow's nest kept falling off, but I realized that you need to sandwich the triangular cylinder between the four studs in the crows nest. the front brown piece is new, and it is a great new piece made just for this ship. the steering wheel is the average car steering wheel, which isn't right for a ship. I do wish it came with an anchor, like any ship would. Also it is missing the two string ladders used to get up to the crow's nest. the cabin is the most creative part, where the window panes are brought back from old castle sets, and are slanted like a real ship's. It does come with a rudder, a simple triangle flag piece.

column1: The little sand dune is simple, though it made perfect, because there is a hinged rock in the front and when you open it up, the treasure chest is hidden inside for the crew to get out. I am sad that lego got rid of the old gold coin pieces and replaced it with boring old pearl gold studs. The cannon is ordinary, but the wheel studs
All in all, this is a good set to have, but I wouldn't jump at the chance to get it. That is all. I hope you liked my review and will like

rnsrobot,"2014-09-11T17:40:50.793Z","Amazing","

I bought this set to give my daughter a little pirate ship to play with, since the Black Pearl is generally off-limits without supervision. Turns out it'
Lots of green. The island is chockful of parts to use in other pirate or castle situations. Firing cannon. The ship hull will be harder to reuse but whatever.
Never really watched Spongebob but these are creative and fun. I do like that Spongebob has a stud on his head so you can attach all sorts of hats or bricks for fun. Treasure map!
This set is the epitome of clever. The little island is more intricate than you'
column2: d expect and creates a lot of texture and setting with a small piece&nbsp
column4: The pirate ship itself is so well done. Uses hinges nicely to create the cartoony, disproportionate cabin. Little details make the difference and it&#39
column5: s quite surprising how well it comes together. The rails and sail are a little easy to knock off but other than that...

column1: Very impressed with the great little scene and two solid, "
column3: but detailed models you get out of it. The ship certainly seems haunted and looks slightly creepy. Playability is good. Fire the cannon! Find the treasure chest! A figure can even walk the tiny plank. And it&#39

column1: Lego pirate ships are generally expensive, hundred dollar+ sets most kids can'
column2: t afford. A small ship was a great idea, and the execution is great. If you&#39
column3: re a Spongebob fan, great. If you aren&#39
column4: t, ditch the minifigures and you&#39

column1:
,TRUE,5,4,4,5,5 plantman","2012-09-06T18:23:23.653Z","My favorite Spongebob set!","

This set has so much going for it as I see it - Spongebob, Pirates, spooky/Halloween.
column2: A definite winner in my book.&nbsp
column3: It includes the flying Duthcman, Pirate Spongebob and Pirate Patrick.&nbsp
column4: The Dutchman is one of my all-time favorite figures.&nbsp
column5: The set itself consists of a small ship and a little island.
column6: The little ship is perfect for this little set.
column7: It contains black and green elements which add to the ghostly feel of the Dutchman.&nbsp
column8: It has a little cabin with lanterns, a skull and bones sail, crowsnest and molded bow.&nbsp
column9: On its own it reminds me of a mini set of a large ship.&nbsp
column12: piece has a dock, rocks with plants and a cannon.&nbsp
column13: The cannon fires little translucent blue studs (bubble cannon?).&nbsp
column14: It also makes a great little accent piece that could go with any pirate themed display.&nbsp
column17: this should have been a $20 set, but I didn't hesitate at the $25&nbsp
column18:
shelf price - I love this set.

column1: The build is what really makes this set shine. For the $20 - $30 range of sets, this one feels a lot bigger than it is. Plus, due mostly to the overall silliness of it, it'
column2: s enormously fun to put together. The island is also a lot more involved than it looks from the outside.

column1: The island is ugly, but it has some charm. It would be right at home on a mini-golf course.

column2: t care about play value, but this one has too much to ignore. All three figures fit on the ship quite comfortably. Mix that with the cannon and island and buried treasure and&nbsp

t like SpongeBob (if there are any), this set has a lot of fun to offer.
